answers.answer: I remember you!  Yes, you've had this a long, long times.There are several different types of yeast, and standard yeast medications don't work for the more uncommon types.  You may need to start fresh with a new doctor and insist on an actual yeast culture to identify the exact type of yeast that may be growing.The other thing to consider is that perhaps its not yeast.  There are other conditions that cause chronic pain, itching, and discharge.  A skilled and caring gynecologist will need to work with you to figure out whats really going on, and to try to figure out what to do about it.

Being a diabetic does predispose you to the joys of chronic yeast.  Sometimes a lenthgy treatment is required. In otherwords, instead of just treating when the symptoms show up, you continually treat for 6mo to a year.It would be wise to try and find out for sure if you do suffer from chronic yeast and not just vaginitis which is really hard to pin down the cause.  Be aware that 50% of all yeast cultures, KOH preps and slides are negative.Find a good gyn that deals with chronic vulvo vaginal issues.  You need someone who understands what is going on won't just treat you without finding out what is wrong and why it's happening.

I also suffered from reoccurant yeast infections. One thing that helped me TREMENDOUSLY was the use of boric acid suppositories. Many medical providers do not know about this treatment, but it has been proven very effective at treating resistant infections. Basically, boric acid is available over-the-counter, but you may have to call a few drug stores to find one that carries it. The pharmacist can fill some gelatin capsules for you, but you can actually do it yourself if you prefer. You can order boric acid online and fill your own capsules. Insert vaginally at night, just don't get any in your mouth. There is also a prepared homopathic treatment that uses boric acid and several herbs called "Yeast Arrest". You can probably find it a health food store or herbalist. Hope this helps.

I too have type 1 diabetes and have struggled with a never ending yeast infection for about 2-3 years. I've been to a few OBGYNs and just got treated for symptoms. They did test for everything from STDs to BV, turns out I have something called Candida albicans. I also went to my endocrinologist and he said that uncontrolled diabetes is the culprit. I got a 10 day treatment of vaginal supositories as well as a dose of  diflucan for me and my partner but a week after I finished my treatment I got a light yeast infection and then it got progressively worse with each infection there after. Now I just treat with Garlic. It relieves my symptoms with just a few days of use and I've just sort of have learnt to deal with the infections. I use a clove of garlic as a vaginal supository for 3 days and start getting relief  from the itching like 10 minutes after insertion. The infection does go away for a bit even if it comes back a week later but I just do it again and am not that concerned because it should be less harmful than all those creams, pills and supositories.
